titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Clark University Library collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Savannah Pham

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-11-11T14:44-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Collection rehoused and processed by Savannah Pham.

did.abstract: Pamphlets, leaflets, newspaper articles, proclamations, letters, miscellaneous propaganda forms, memorabilia, and photographs relating to American neutrality and subsequent participation in World War I. Includes proofs of war loan appeals and German propaganda banners. Collected by Clark University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Clark University Library collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Clark University is a private American university and liberal arts college founded in Worcester, Massachussetts in 1887. It is the oldest educational institution founded as an all-graduate university in the United States. Clark College opened for undergraduates in 1902 and was managed independently from Clark University until 1920.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Clark University Library collection contains pamphlets, leaflets, newspaper articles, proclamations, letters, various propaganda forms, memorabilia, and photographs relating to American neutrality and subsequent participation in World War I. The collection also includes proofs of war loan appeals and German propaganda banners. These materials were collected by Clark University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The majority of the correspondence within this collection was sent to Louis Wilson, the librarian of Clark University.
